QAPair.Question: What is (are) Prediabetes ?
QAPair.Answer: Prediabetes occurs when the level of sugar (glucose) in your blood is too high, but not high enough to be called diabetes . If you have prediabetes, you are at an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes within 10 years. It also increases your risk for heart disease and stroke. Losing extra weight and getting regular exercise will reduce the chance of your prediabetes becoming type 2 diabetes.
